sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Bulk Density Apparatus for determination of bulk density and tapped density of pharmaceutical powders and granules.
sections.scope: Applicable to bulk and tapped density measurement activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the apparatus is placed on a stable, level surface.
Verify that the graduated measuring cylinder is clean and dry.
Record the volume capacity and divisions of the measuring cylinder.
Weigh the empty graduated cylinder and record the weight.
Select an appropriate quantity of powder or granules (typically sufficient to fill cylinder to 50-100 mL).
Weigh the powder sample accurately on an analytical balance and record the weight.
Carefully transfer the powder into the graduated cylinder through a funnel if needed.
Avoid compacting the powder during transfer to maintain natural bulk.
Note the initial volume occupied by the powder (V₀) as the bulk volume.
Calculate the bulk density using: Bulk Density = Mass / V₀.
For tapped density, secure the cylinder in the tapping apparatus holder.
Set the tapping height and frequency as per USP or other pharmacopeial standards (typically 3 mm drop, 250 taps).
Start the tapping cycle and allow the apparatus to perform the set number of taps.
Record the volume after the first set of taps (typically after 500 taps).
Continue tapping in increments (250 taps) until the volume change is less than 2 mL.
Record the final tapped volume (Vf).
Calculate tapped density using: Tapped Density = Mass / Vf.
Calculate Hausner ratio: Hausner Ratio = Tapped Density / Bulk Density.
Calculate Carr's Index: Carr's Index = [(Vf - V₀) / Vf] × 100.
Clean the cylinder and apparatus thoroughly after use.
Document all measurements, calculations, and observations in the analytical record.
precautions: Use sufficient powder quantity to minimize measurement errors.
Avoid pre-compacting or vibrating the powder during transfer.
Ensure the cylinder is properly secured in the tapping apparatus.
Use consistent tapping parameters for reproducible results.
Perform measurements at controlled temperature and humidity.
Handle hygroscopic powders quickly to minimize moisture absorption.
Clean equipment thoroughly between different samples.
Perform triplicate measurements for statistical validity.
Wear appropriate PPE including mask and gloves when handling powders.
